reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars CHILLING!! SERIOUS PAGE TURNER!!
reviews.reviewText: This book literally kept me on the edge of my seat....and up well past my bedtime. I couldn't put it down! If it weren't for working a full time job, I would have read it all in one day versus over the course of three nights.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good book, great ending.
reviews.reviewText: Easy to ready, well written, I loved the ending. *spoiler* my only issue is that she didn't tell her parents when she had the chance. They would have been the only sure fire people to have known she wasn't mentally incapacitated. A little frustrating at that point but all in all i will be reading more by this author, I enjoyed the book quite a bit.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: 5/5 stars!! I had goosebumps the entire time. I was so angry with both the main characters. I predicted the end, but the way the end happened, I was shocked. I loved it. Every minute of it!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars I don’t really know..
reviews.reviewText: I do not know how to feel about this book. I usually finish a book within a day or two after starting, I enjoy my wind down in the evenings to read my kindle, or during school pick up I read. This book had such a hold on me bad and good. It was so repetitive and frustrating half of the book. Grace felt that she couldn’t escape, he painted this image of her using a mental illness, as said in the book - he was always one step ahead of her. But that’s what made it so aggravating to read. Surely, people you would call friends in either side on the picture cannot be so oblivious to such a “perfect marriage” the fact they shared an email made it so unreal. I guess I looked at the situation as I’m an Esther. I look at the perspective differently and I’m not a naive person, which I will call out. And the fact that Jack often spoke for Grace, was so annoying and how there wasn’t much more fight to this aspect. Wonderful Millie, thought of how to take him down, and I would have fought so much harder when Esther was prying. With all the dinner parties I would have clung to anyone and proved to them the red room, where she sleeps, I just felt there were so many missed opportunities by Grace that I couldn’t continue reading. So I put the book down until the following night, it really wasn’t until Millie gave Grace the idea that the book really intrigued and I couldn’t put it down. That was disappointing because the book was basically over at that point. The ending, I wish there had been more but honestly I felt the author didn’t even give us enough throughout the whole book why would I expect more at the end. It’s an ok read again, until your closer to the end. I wanted to give my review because I love reading, I understand that this can be real like, but Grace was weak and I felt she could have done so much more, it was fight to keep Millie away but I truly didn’t see the fight, beautiful Millie did it all on her own.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Girl, you did that!
reviews.reviewText: Tears of gratitude prick my eyes at the completion of reading this book. It’s a story that needed to be told and the author did a fantastic job telling it. Thank you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This book was so good. I was holding on to every word, and was so interested when there was an Autistic main character in the book. It made it so much more interesting as the family dynamic was very different than the usual book. This was so, so good and so, so twisty.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Well written book that keeps you on the edge of your seat. It pains me to see such low ratings on this book. I really enjoyed it. BA Paris is a true mastermind. One of the few books that have exceeded my expectations. This unique, thrilling and exciting book is truly satisfying. Overall, I recommend this for a weekend read. I say weekend because you definitely will not out this book down.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Behind Closed Doors
reviews.reviewText: I thought the writing was well done, the story line was interesting and had just enough twists and turns to keep you enthralled!I will say it was pretty predictable that she would do what she ended up doing but the how and the plot ties to the beginning was well done!It does show the hard corners being in an abusive relationship can put you in.Don’t think I’ll ever read it again but it was a good read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This book was one of the most gripping physio story I've read in a while. I couldn't put it down.I was a bit disappointed with the ending would have wanted it to continue with a full investigation. But haven't said that, loved how the writer wrote a good outcome.A must read
Schönes Buch mit guter Qualität. Alles wie erwartet. Der Versand war schnell und zuverlässig. Danke, gerne wieder
Although the plot has hints of a lot of other books involving domestic violence, the treatment here is very different. The climax is even more delightful.

reviews.reviewTitle: one of those thrillers that STAY with you
reviews.reviewText: La fin... ça vaut le suspense. C'est très émouvant.Je n'ai pas compris la note de 4 étoiles. C'est vraiment l'un des meilleurs thrillers commerciaux que j'ai lu. Et j'en ai lu plus de 100.
